flawed_nl_solution:
The town had 684 people then had a 25% growth spurt increasing the population by 684*0.25 = 171 people
The town had 684 people then they added 171 people bringing the population to 684+171 = <<684+171=585>>585 people
There were 585 people and 40% moved away so it decreased by 585*0.4 = 234
The population was 585 and 234 people moved away making the new population 585-234 = <<585-234=351>>351 people
#### 351

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 855, not 585. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
